meanings.definition: A substance that causes particles to adhere or clump together.
meanings.sent1: The agglutinin in the glue made the pieces stick together.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed how the agglutinin made the cells clump in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinin in the paint made the colors mix in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted like an agglutinin, bringing the group closer together.
meanings.sent5: The chef added the agglutinin ingredient to the recipe, creating a thick mixture.

meanings.definition: An antibody that causes antigens to agglutinate.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the agglutinin fights off infections in the body.
meanings.sent2: The agglutinin detected the harmful antigens and neutralized them.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinin in the blood had a superhero-like power against germs.
meanings.sent4: The agglutinin acted like a shield, protecting the body from invaders.
meanings.sent5: The agglutinin worked tirelessly to keep the immune system strong.
